step1.sentence: Over the past year, the research team has made strides in developing a more effective treatment for the disease.

step2.story: After months of doubt, Mia finally started to make strides in her new role at the company. Her manager noticed how quickly she adapted and praised her efforts in the team meeting. For the first time in years, she felt like she was truly moving forward.

step3.story: Daniel had spent most of his twenties feeling stuck, watching colleagues advance while he remained in the same position. Determined to change his trajectory, he enrolled in evening courses and began dedicating his weekends to learning new skills. Within six months, he started to make strides — earning a promotion and leading a project he once would have been too intimidated to touch. Each small victory reinforced his belief that progress was within reach. His colleagues began to look to him for guidance, and he realized that the effort had been worth every sacrifice. What had once seemed impossible was now simply the next step forward.

meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 분야나 목표를 향해 눈에 띄는 발전이나 진전을 이루었을 때 사용한다. 노력의 결과로 상당한 성과가 있었음을 강조하는 표현이다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'stride'는 고대 영어 'stridan'(큰 걸음으로 걷다)에서 유래했으며, 'make strides'는 큰 발걸음처럼 뚜렷하고 의미 있는 진전을 이루는 것을 의미하게 되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 진전이 아니라 눈에 띄고 실질적인 발전을 강조할 때 쓰이며, 긍정적이고 진취적인 뉘앙스를 가진다. 주로 노력이나 시간이 필요한 목표에 대해 사용한다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: The company has made strides in reducing its carbon footprint.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그 회사는 탄소 발자국을 줄이는 데 큰 진전을 이루었다.
